intro: Annesorhiza grandiflora, commonly known as the showy annesorhiza, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features a tall, slender stem with large, showy white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Annesorhiza grandiflora is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
